message.content: This question requires knowledge about the process of condensation. Condensation occurs when a gas or vapor transforms into a liquid. Option (D) is the best example of condensation because when a frosty beverage is left out, water vapor in the surrounding air condenses on the cold surface of the glass, forming droplets of liquid water. Option (A) is incorrect because cats licking their fur is not an example of condensation. Option (B) is incorrect because headphones falling into a puddle does not involve condensation. Option (C) is incorrect because hail is formed through a different process called deposition, where water vapor skips the liquid phase and freezes directly into solid ice.

This question requires knowledge about the process of condensation. Condensation occurs when water vapor cools and changes from a gas to a liquid. Option (D), water forming on a frosty beverage, is the best example of condensation because the cold temperature of the beverage causes the water vapor in the air to condense and form droplets on the outside of the glass. Option (A) is incorrect because cats licking their fur is unrelated to the process of condensation. Option (B) is unrelated to condensation and is more related to an object falling into a puddle. Option (C) is unrelated to condensation and is related to the process of solid precipitation.

Option (B) describes an object falling into a puddle, which is not condensation. Option (C) describes a type of precipitation, not condensation.

Option (B) is incorrect because headphones falling into a puddle is an example of submersion, not condensation. Option (C) is incorrect because hail falling from the sky is an example of precipitation, not condensation.
